result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barbara L. Roggow

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant opts in for text message reminders.

Order Modifying Bail.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED,
1) The cash bond posted on 3-28-2022 shall be held by the clerk of courts until the case has been completed.
2) The defendant shall be placed on a signature bond with all previous conditions.
3) The defendant shall appear before Branch 3 for future bail hearings, not the court commissioner.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:32 p.m.  Defendant in custody.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed that mirrors complaint.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Status conference scheduled for 9/2/22, 2:00 p.m., Br. 3, Zoom.
BAIL MOTION:  Court amends bail from $500 cash bail to $500.00 personal recognizance.  All conditions remain as originally ordered.  Cash bail posted is to be held pending disposition of the case.  If defendant is brought in on a warrant, she is to come before Judge Dewane, not the court commissioner.  Atty. Farhrenkrug to draft order. 
Minutes.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for a preliminary hearing on 6-22-22 at 1:30pm in Br. 3 (VIA ZOOM).  FORFEITURE STOPPED. $250 cash previously furnished is continued AND court adds additional $250 cash for a total of $500 cash bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Jeremy Robinson and she must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. 
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:56 a.m.  Non-appearance by defendant.  Warrant issued on the State's motion.   State moves to forfeit bail.  Motion granted.
Minutes

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-12-22 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Barbara L. Roggow
Current: 2412 13th Street A, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2022)
Prior: 1806 Columbus St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

$250.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.    
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Robert M. Lewis, 1806 Columbus Street, Manitowoc, WI   54220.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC, possess methamphetamine and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Jeremy Robinson, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must provide and address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.
